verses.text_plain: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.
verses.verse_html: 1By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.

verses.text_plain: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.
verses.verse_html: 2We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.

verses.text_plain: For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.
verses.verse_html:
3For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion. ▼
▼ a song: Heb. the words of a song
 , ▼
▼ wasted…: Heb. laid us on heaps

tokens.text: For there they that carried us away captive

footnotes.body_text: ▼ a song: Heb. the words of a song
footnotes.body_html: ▼ a song: Heb. the words of a song

footnotes.body_text: ▼ wasted…: Heb. laid us on heaps
footnotes.body_html: ▼ wasted…: Heb. laid us on heaps

verses.text_plain: How shall we sing the Lord’s song in a strange land?
verses.verse_html:
4How shall we sing the Lord’s song in a strange land? ▼
▼ strange…: Heb. land of a stranger?

footnotes.body_text: ▼ strange…: Heb. land of a stranger?
footnotes.body_html: ▼ strange…: Heb. land of a stranger?

verses.text_plain: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her cunning.
verses.verse_html: 5If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her cunning.

verses.text_plain: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.
verses.verse_html:
6If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy. ▼
▼ my chief…: Heb. the head of my joy

tokens.text: to the roof of my mouth

footnotes.body_text: ▼ my chief…: Heb. the head of my joy
footnotes.body_html: ▼ my chief…: Heb. the head of my joy

verses.text_plain: Remember, O Lord, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof.
verses.verse_html:
7Remember, O Lord, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof. ▼
▼ Rase it: Heb. Make bare

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Rase it: Heb. Make bare

verses.text_plain: O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.
verses.verse_html:
8O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us. ▼
▼ destroyed: Heb. wasted
 , ▼
▼ rewardeth…: Heb. recompenseth unto thee thy deed which thou didst to us

footnotes.body_text: ▼ rewardeth…: Heb. recompenseth unto thee thy deed which thou didst to us
footnotes.body_html: ▼ rewardeth…: Heb. recompenseth unto thee thy deed which thou didst to us

verses.text_plain: Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones.
verses.verse_html:
9Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones. ▼
▼ the stones: Heb. the rock

footnotes.body_html: ▼ the stones: Heb. the rock
